alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:01PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York, including the following counties, Clinton, Essex and Franklin and central Vermont, including the following county, Addison. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 158 PM EST, local law enforcement reported flooding due to heavy rain in the warned area, leading to some closed roads. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake Placid, Saranac Lake, Moriah, Willsboro, Westport, Wilmington, Elizabethtown, Keene, Minerva, Newcomb, Keene Valley, Mount Marcy, Jay In Essex County, Schroon Lake, Au Sable Forks, Port Henry, Crown Point Center, Addison, Keeseville and Port Kent. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
